instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165-A Power Button Not working
threads.message:
A1466 Power Button not working.
No WD, board looks great.
replaced keyboard flex
then replaced keyboard
same issue.
powers on perfect. all keys and key combos work.

threads.title: 820-00165-A Power Button Not working
threads.message:
Does it power up when you use short the “smc_onoff_L” + “ground” on the logicboard?
have you try another trackpad?
have you inspect the J4800 trackpad connector?

threads.title: 820-00165-A Power Button Not working
threads.message: Exactly what Alan said see if it powers on when you short the power pads first.

threads.title: 820-00165-A Power Button Not working
threads.message:
sorry guys been super busy, pulling this one back out.
ok so shorting SMC on/off does turn the board on 
tried another track pad
and using a new flex.
thank you

threads.title: 820-00165-A Power Button Not working
threads.message:
Power button line goes to trackpad board, then directly to trackpad flex.
Has nothing to do with trackpad electronic circuitry; is just a trace in that board.
Your issue should be on trackpad connecor J4800, or SMC_ONOFF_L trace doesn't arrive there.
Check trace for continuity and contact inside J4800 pin 20.
